title: Salt River Bay National Historical Park and Ecological Preserve: Park Home
body: Come Explore 2000 Years of Human History in the Caribbean  Salt River Bay National Historical Park and Ecological Preserve uniquely documents the human and natural Caribbean world from the earliest indigenous settlements in the central Caribbean to their clash with seven different colonial European powers to the present day..              Things to Do   Scuba diving, snorkeling, kayaking, and hiking tours            Visiting Salt River   A Living Museum Where Nature and History Blend        Archaeological Sites    The prehistoric complex at Salt River, is one of the most important archaeological sites in the Virgin Islands
